intro: Piptocelus, commonly known as the common velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, dry seeds. Piptocelus is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in many regions.
